meanings.definition: The act of determining or predetermining an outcome
meanings.sent1: Her fating of success motivated her to work hard.
meanings.sent2: The fating of the weather forecast helped them plan the picnic.
meanings.sent3: His fating of winning the lottery seemed like wishful thinking.
meanings.sent4: The fating of the coin toss decided who would go first.
meanings.sent5: The fating of the test results made her anxious.

meanings.sent1: The fating of the delicious cake was a delightful experience.
meanings.sent2: Healthy fating habits contribute to overall well-being.
meanings.sent3: His fating of the spicy chili made his taste buds tingle.
meanings.sent4: The fating of the buffet left them feeling satisfied.
meanings.sent5: Mindful fating can help maintain a balanced diet.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging or scheduling a future event
meanings.sent1: The fating of the meeting was done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Proper fating of tasks ensures a smooth workflow.
meanings.sent3: Her fating of the party clashed with another event.
meanings.sent4: The fating of the concert coincided with their anniversary.
meanings.sent5: Effective fating of appointments prevents double booking.
